data.event: The earliest documented settlement occurred around 1771, many of the settlers migrating from Connecticut.
The town, originally called Dunning Street, was created in 1802 from part of the Town of Stillwater.

event.title: was gained from the Town of Saratoga in 1805

data.event: More territory was gained from the Town of Saratoga in 1805.

event.title: was formerly called "Malt-ville" and is now

data.event: The name "Malta" is said to derive from a malt brewery in the area that was formerly called "Malt-ville" and is now Maltaville.
The village of Round Lake was founded in 1868 as "the Round Lake Camp Meeting of the Methodist Episcopical Church."
In 1869 permanent cottages began to be built, replacing the original tents.

event.title: 1969, the community of Round Lake became

data.event: In 1969, the community of Round Lake became an incorporated village within the town.
